wikipedia_page.main: Harold James Hughes (8 October 1929 - 15 October 2013) was an English professional footballer. His clubs included Chelsea, Bournemouth & Boscombe Athletic and Gillingham, where he made over 200 Football League appearances. He was captain of the Bournemouth team that knocked out Wolverhampton Wanderers and Tottenham Hotspur before losing to Manchester United in the quarter-finals of the FA Cup in 1957.

response: Harry Hughes (1926–2019) was an American politician.
Harry Hughes may also refer to:
* Harry Hughes (footballer, born 1929) (1929–2013), English former footballer
* Harry Hughes (director), British film director and screenwriter
